Overall, if cost is a main concern, and you want stay in a basic room for $50 with decent service, in an acceptable neighborhood, then you apparently dont have enough $$$ to stay in a San Francisco hotel, try an upgrade to a local hostel, or stay home.
If you are at all sensitive to noise, then it is very important that you get a room in the back of the hotel.

Room layout good - but would recommend some barrier to stop water from the shower getting the carpet wet
I highly recommend spending the extra money and staying in one of the rooms on the club level.
Our Classic room was a bit small and you might consider upgrading to a larger room if you are staying for very long.
We were in a deluxe room ,dont be fooled, these are the basic rooms, which was really small, compared to the fantastic villa we had in Benoa for less then half the price,

In conclusion, If you are an American planning on going to the Dominican Republic, Think it twice please.
If you like quietness, as I do, ask for a room at the backside not fasing the street and higher up.

A must if you have an unlimited expense account since the rooms are very expensive but certainly worthwhile

Walking to the shops, you may want to mentally prepare yourself for the abuse you will take from the local shop owners,aka vultures, that will swoop down upon you to practically drag you into their shops.

Breakfast was quite pricey at 18euros each, but it was a buffet you could eat as much as you like, so if you have a big appetite, perhaps its good value, and if you didnt want to pay 18euros then dont eat it...
Stay away from this hotel, if you really need to be downtown stay in a well known chain for a few extra bucks, your peace of mind will be worth it.
Tip: pay in cash and have a Rick Steves book to get discounts.

The location is amazing, very near the Duomo ,if you are a light sleeper this can be bad for the tolling bells,, just around the corner from the Piazza Republica and down the street from the Uffizi museum and square.

They offer handicapped accessible rooms which are more spacious and located at the enterior of the hotel ,which I would recommend as those staying with rooms facing the streets often complain of the noise,.
Dont forget to tip...
Tip, tip, tip and you will not be sorry.
Although there are many choices, dont go with an expectation that you will be having a fine dining experience.
Drinks: Unless you like really sweet drinks, you might want to consider bringing your own mixers..

Wonderful hotel but bring your ear plugs

Weve stayed in San Francisco before and I would recommend the Commodore Hotel or another Experience Rewards hotel in the SF area.
Note that the hotel offers great packages on its website - the best way to go.

Bigger rooms , bar at ground floor, bigger reception, but then it wouldnt be the hotel that it is .

If you need to get out and roam, this is not the resort for you, as you are miles away from anything, however there is so much to do right there at the resort I cant imagine why you would need to go anywhere.
If you want to rent a car, rent it at the airport, not the resort
They wanted over $300 for 4 days, and we ended up renting at Enterprise for about $125 insurance included , after driving in Puerto Rico I highly recommend taking there insurance,.
Through the resort you can contact a guy named Angel for some of the best scuba diving I have ever done in my life.
The hotel decor is very tasteful and trendy, and while the wallpaper may need a tiny bit of work here and there, as has been mentioned before, its really not a big deal.
Rooms are clean and nice, but bear in mind you just pay for lodging, service does not seem to be included.
Both places are highly recommended.

I recommend not staying in room X01-X12 where X is the floor number.

If you go to the Mexican, dont leave without savoring mega amounts of a local topping called pico de gauaio.

Other than the frozen drinks, I would not reccommend a mixed drink here.

Finally, if you stay here, be very careful when going down into the metro and all of the time you stay on the metro.

Put your valuables in a zippered pouch inside your clothing, dont carry a backpack, keep an eye on anything you put down beside you in a restaurant, walk in caravans, dont let people surround you on the metro: make sure you are near an exit door.
Be aware of your surroundings at all times, and you wont be a victim.

For the location, you are much better off at the Hyatt Regency.

If youre looking for a reasonably priced nice hotel steps away from the beach, I would recommend staying at the Waikiki Parc.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to avoid the giant impersonal hotels, as you will have all the amenities and none of the hassle.
